initial_story: My observation is there exists unequal share of State monies with its residents, before all the Urban residents get defensive please hear me out. Presently no one except Corporations pay State income taxes. No individual pays state taxes. I noticed state funded bicycle paths, road maintenance, defunct Docks, powerful politicians pet projects such as office buildings, state troopers etc, etc. all these fundings and more are not necessary within City limits, I was amazed at how much our state provides city functions in the bigger cities thus growing the state budget, I saw on tv last night how adg&g was showing the little ones how to ice fish, couldn't the parents do that? yes I pay property taxes. But I will guarantee you once our City folk get the full bill with out the State monies we will not be as wasteful, on the office building...rent what space you need and help the office rental marked. In my business I just retired from,I would ask my managers, "how do you stop spending money"?
stories: I have observed that there is an uneven distribution of state funds among its residents. Before you get defensive, please hear me out. Currently, only corporations pay state income taxes. No individual pays state taxes. I noticed that there are state-funded bicycle paths, road maintenance, defunct docks, powerful politicians' pet projects such as office buildings, state troopers, and much more. These are not necessary within city limits. I was amazed at how much the state provides for city functions in larger cities, thus increasing the state budget. I saw on TV last night how Adg&G was showing the little ones how to ice fish. Couldn't the parents do that? Yes, I pay property taxes. But I will guarantee you once our City folks get the full bill without the State monies, we will not be as wasteful. On the office building, rent what space you need and help the office rental market. In my business, I just retired from, I would ask my managers, "how do you stop spending money?"

As a tax expert, I have observed that the state's budget is unevenly distributed. It is unfair for corporations to be the only ones paying state income taxes while individuals do not contribute. The state provides many amenities within city limits, such as state-funded bicycle paths, road maintenance, defunct docks, and powerful politicians' pet projects. These services increase the state budget, which is not necessary. It is wasteful for the city to rely on state funding instead of managing its resources. I believe that once the City gets the full bill without the State monies, they will not be as wasteful. The office building should be rented out instead of being funded by the state. In my business, I always asked my managers, "how do you stop spending money?"
